description.narrative: With the funds, the Colectivo Las Ramonas Revolucionarias (Ramonas Revolutionaries Collective) will present and circulate a short documentary that addresses the risk and situation of women and their families in the Lake Poopo communities in Oruro from contamination from companies and transnational mines in the region. It will share the film in a variety of spaces to promote the discussion around initiatives, socio environmental problems, and gender. Lake Poopo and the surrounding region have been plagued for decades by mining initiatives without any environmental control. The resulting environmental contamination has drastically impacted the agriculture, livestock, and fishing based livelihoods of community families. Impacts range from death of cattle and contamination of drinking water to soil pollution and deterioration in human health. Women, who traditionally relied on reed handicrafts and arts, have been particulary impacted and two social phenomena are on the rise: migration to urban areas for work is growing and families left behind are seeing their conditions degrading. The collective will research and record the environmental impacts of mining in the region and the cultural practices of local women. It will organize the process and audiovisual material to develop the documentary and share the film in schools, self organized spaces, and debates.
